meanings.definition: A device used to measure the angle of inclination or slope.
meanings.sent1: The inclinometers helped the construction workers check the slope of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The inclinometers on the ship ensured it maintained the correct angle in the rough sea.
meanings.sent3: The inclinometers decided to have a race to see who could measure the steepest slope.
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like that of inclinometers, always accurately gauging the situation.
meanings.sent5: The inclinometers whispered the exact angle of the mountain, revealing its secrets.

meanings.definition: Instruments used to determine the angle of tilt or slope in various applications.
meanings.sent1: The inclinometers in the laboratory were crucial for measuring the slope of the test surface.
meanings.sent2: Engineers rely on inclinometers to assess the tilt of structures like bridges and buildings.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the inclinometers were mistaken for fancy thermometers by the curious children.
meanings.sent4: The inclinometers in his mind always kept him balanced, never swaying too far in any direction.
meanings.sent5: The inclinometers hummed with precision, revealing the exact angle of the slope.
